com.gollahalli.azure

Class AzureBlobUpload

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gollahalli.azure.AzureBlobUpload

  • public class AzureBlobUpload
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements uploading files to Azure blob containers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AzureBlobUpload(java.lang.String accountName, java.lang.String accountKey, java.lang.String containerName)
      Implements uploading files to Azure blob containers with HTTPS as true by default.
      AzureBlobUpload(java.lang.String accountName, java.lang.String accountKey, java.lang.String containerName, boolean useHttps)
      Implements uploading files to Azure blob containers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Upload a single file to the root of Azure container.

      Upload a single file to Azure blob and specify the path to the blob folder.
      java.net.URI uploadFromFolder(java.lang.String folderPath)
      Do a recursive upload of the folder path provided.
      java.net.URI uploadFromFolder(java.lang.String folderPath, java.lang.String blobPath)
      Do a recursive upload of the folder path provided to a given blob path.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AzureBlobUpload

        public AzureBlobUpload(java.lang.String accountName,
                       java.lang.String accountKey,
                       java.lang.String containerName,
                       boolean useHttps)
        Implements uploading files to Azure blob containers.
        Parameters:
        accountName - Account name from your Access Keys.
        accountKey - Account key from your Access Keys.
        containerName - Container name you want to uploadFromFile or create.
        useHttps - true to use HTTPS to connect to the storage service endpoints; otherwise, false. Defaults to true.

      • AzureBlobUpload

        public AzureBlobUpload(java.lang.String accountName,
                       java.lang.String accountKey,
                       java.lang.String containerName)
        Implements uploading files to Azure blob containers with HTTPS as true by default.
        Parameters:
        accountName - Account name from your Access Keys.
        accountKey - Account key from your Access Keys.
        containerName - Container name you want to uploadFromFile or create.

    • Method Detail

      • uploadFromFile

        public java.net.URI uploadFromFile(java.lang.String pathFileName,
                                   java.lang.String blobPath)
                            throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                   com.microsoft.azure.storage.StorageException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Upload a single file to Azure blob and specify the path to the blob folder.

        Example: 

             
      AzureBlobUpload blobUpload = new AzureBlobUpload("account name", "account key", "container name");
      URI uri = blobUpload.uploadFromFile("c:/path/to/fileName.txt", "path/to/blob/");
        Parameters:
        pathFileName - Absolute path with file name.
        blobPath - Path of the blob folder.
        Returns:
        URL of the uploaded file.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - If an invalid account name is provided.
        com.microsoft.azure.storage.StorageException - Storage error.
        java.io.IOException - If the file does not exist.

      • uploadFromFile

        public java.net.URI uploadFromFile(java.lang.String pathFileName)
                            throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                   com.microsoft.azure.storage.StorageException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Upload a single file to the root of Azure container.

        Example: 

             
      AzureBlobUpload blobUpload = new AzureBlobUpload("account name", "account key", "container name");
      URI uri = blobUpload.uploadFromFile("c:/path/to/fileName.txt");
        Parameters:
        pathFileName - Absolute path with file name.
        Returns:
        URL of the uploaded file.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - If an invalid account name is provided.
        com.microsoft.azure.storage.StorageException - Storage error.
        java.io.IOException - If the file does not exist.

      • uploadFromFolder

        public java.net.URI uploadFromFolder(java.lang.String folderPath,
                                     java.lang.String blobPath)
                              throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                     com.microsoft.azure.storage.StorageException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Do a recursive upload of the folder path provided to a given blob path.

        Example: 

             
      AzureBlobUpload blobUpload = new AzureBlobUpload("account name", "account key", "container name");
      URI uri = blobUpload.uploadFromFolder("c:/path/to/", "path/tp/blob/");
        Parameters:
        folderPath - Absolute path to a folder.
        blobPath - Path of the blob folder.
        Returns:
        URI of the uploaded location.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Is used by CloudStorageAccount.
        com.microsoft.azure.storage.StorageException - If container is not found.
        java.io.IOException - If your absolute path contains no file.

      • uploadFromFolder

        public java.net.URI uploadFromFolder(java.lang.String folderPath)
                              throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                     com.microsoft.azure.storage.StorageException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Do a recursive upload of the folder path provided.

        Example: 

             
      AzureBlobUpload blobUpload = new AzureBlobUpload("account name", "account key", "container name");
      URI uri = blobUpload.uploadFromFolder("c:/path/to/");
        Parameters:
        folderPath - Absolute path to a folder.
        Returns:
        URI of the uploaded file.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Is used by CloudStorageAccount.
        com.microsoft.azure.storage.StorageException - If container is not found.
        java.io.IOException - If your absolute path contains no file.
